events.title: Russian money laundering and gambling ring busted in Trump Tower
events.description: New York authorities bust a money-laundering and illegal gambling operation run by Russian organized crime figures out of unit 63A in Trump Tower, directly below Trump's own penthouse. The operation allegedly had ties to Russian mob boss Semion Mogilevich and was overseen by Alimzhan Tokhtakhounov, who later appeared as a VIP at Trump's Miss Universe pageant in Moscow.

sources.description: Russian gangs of New York: Putin's new order

events.title: Trump meets with Aras and Emin Agalarov in Las Vegas
events.description: Trump meets with Russian billionaire Aras Agalarov and his son Emin in Las Vegas during the Miss USA pageant. They agree to bring the Miss Universe pageant to Moscow, with Agalarov agreeing to pay approximately $20 million for hosting rights. This meeting establishes a relationship that will later become central to the June 2016 Trump Tower meeting.

sources.description: When Donald Trump brought Miss Universe to Moscow

events.title: NY Attorney General files $40 million fraud lawsuit against Trump University
events.description: New York Attorney General Eric Schneiderman files a $40 million civil lawsuit against Trump University, alleging the for-profit education company defrauded more than 5,000 students through misleading marketing practices and unqualified instructors. The case would eventually be settled in 2016 for $25 million.

events.title: Trump signs Dubai golf course deal with DAMAC Properties
events.description: Trump signs a branding and licensing agreement with DAMAC Properties in the United Arab Emirates to develop Trump International Golf Club Dubai and luxury villas. This marks another international expansion of the Trump brand into the Middle East.

sources.description: Trump sons open Dubai golf course, praise U.S. ally

events.title: Miss Universe pageant in Moscow
events.description: The Trump-owned Miss Universe pageant is held in Moscow at Crocus City Hall, owned by Aras Agalarov. During his visit, Trump meets with numerous Russian oligarchs and officials, including Herman Gref (CEO of Sberbank). Trump tweets that he wonders if Putin will attend and become his 'new best friend.' Though Putin does not attend, he reportedly sends Trump a gift and note.

sources.description: When Donald Trump brought Miss Universe to Moscow

events.title: Trump and Agalarovs discuss Trump Tower Moscow plans
events.description: Following the Miss Universe pageant, Trump discusses plans for a Trump Tower in Moscow with the Agalarovs. Trump tweets "TRUMP TOWER-MOSCOW is next." This begins a series of discussions for a potential development that would continue into 2014, with site scouting and preliminary planning. The project ultimately stalled by the end of 2014.

events.title: Alimzhan Tokhtakhounov attends Miss Universe after-party
events.description: Alimzhan Tokhtakhounov, the alleged Russian mob boss who was indicted for running a gambling ring out of Trump Tower but fled prosecution, appears as a VIP guest at the Miss Universe after-party in Moscow, seated near Trump. This occurs just months after Tokhtakhounov's gambling and money laundering operation was busted in Trump Tower.

entity-001.name: Donald J. Trump
entity-001.description: Real estate developer, businessman, and television personality. In 2013, Trump brought his Miss Universe pageant to Moscow, deepened his relationship with Russian business figures, and began discussions about a potential Trump Tower Moscow project with the Agalarovs.

entity-062.name: Alimzhan Tokhtakhounov
entity-062.description: Russian organized crime figure and alleged mob boss who ran a gambling ring and money laundering operation out of Trump Tower in 2013. After the operation was busted by federal authorities in April 2013, he fled prosecution but later appeared as a VIP guest at Trump's Miss Universe pageant in Moscow in November 2013.

entity-063.name: Semion Mogilevich
entity-063.description: Powerful Russian organized crime boss who is considered one of the most dangerous mobsters in the world. The gambling and money laundering operation run out of Trump Tower in 2013 allegedly had ties to his criminal network.

entity-064.name: Aras Agalarov
entity-064.description: Azerbaijani-born Russian billionaire developer and close Putin ally who partnered with Trump to host the 2013 Miss Universe pageant in Moscow. He paid Trump approximately $20 million for the event and later discussed a potential Trump Tower Moscow project. He was awarded the Order of Honor by Putin in 2013.

entity-065.name: Emin Agalarov
entity-065.description: Son of Aras Agalarov, Russian-Azerbaijani pop singer and businessman who was instrumental in bringing the 2013 Miss Universe pageant to Moscow. He served as Vice President of his father's Crocus Group and performed at the pageant. Trump appeared in one of his music videos during the Moscow trip.

entity-066.name: Rob Goldstone
entity-066.description: British music publicist who represented Emin Agalarov and helped facilitate the meeting between Trump and the Agalarovs that led to the 2013 Miss Universe pageant in Moscow. He coordinated press events during Trump's Moscow visit and arranged for Trump to appear in Emin's music video.

entity-067.name: Eric Schneiderman
entity-067.description: New York State Attorney General who filed a $40 million civil fraud lawsuit against Trump University in 2013, alleging the company defrauded over 5,000 students through misleading marketing practices and unqualified instructors.

entity-068.name: DAMAC Properties
entity-068.description: Dubai-based real estate development company that partnered with Trump in 2013 to develop Trump International Golf Club Dubai and luxury villas. The chairman, Hussain Sajwani, later developed a close relationship with the Trump family.

entity-069.name: Herman Gref
entity-069.description: CEO of Sberbank, Russia's largest state-owned bank, and a close ally of Vladimir Putin. Gref met with Trump during the 2013 Miss Universe pageant in Moscow, sitting with him as a VIP guest during the event.

entity-070.name: Crocus Group
entity-070.description: Russian real estate development company owned by Aras Agalarov that hosted the 2013 Miss Universe pageant at its Crocus City Hall venue in Moscow. The company later discussed developing a Trump Tower Moscow project with Trump.

entity-071.name: Vladimir Putin
entity-071.description: President of Russia. Though Putin did not attend the 2013 Miss Universe pageant in Moscow, he reportedly sent Trump a gift and note. Trump frequently praised Putin publicly during this period and tweeted about potentially meeting him during the Moscow trip.

relationships.description: Trump partnered with Aras Agalarov to host the 2013 Miss Universe pageant in Moscow. Agalarov paid approximately $20 million for the event, which was held at his Crocus City Hall. They later discussed developing a Trump Tower Moscow project.

Trump developed a relationship with Emin Agalarov, son of Aras, who was instrumental in bringing the Miss Universe pageant to Moscow. Emin performed at the pageant, and Trump appeared in one of his music videos filmed during the Moscow trip.

Rob Goldstone, as Emin Agalarov's publicist, facilitated the connection between Trump and the Agalarovs for the 2013 Miss Universe pageant in Moscow. He coordinated communication and arranged media events during Trump's Moscow visit.

Alimzhan Tokhtakhounov ran a gambling and money laundering operation out of Trump Tower in 2013, and later appeared as a VIP guest at Trump's Miss Universe pageant in Moscow, seated near Trump. No direct communication between them has been confirmed, but their repeated proximity suggests potential awareness.
Trump met with Herman Gref, CEO of Russia's largest state bank and a close Putin ally, during the 2013 Miss Universe pageant in Moscow. Gref was seated with Trump as a VIP guest during the event.
Trump's Miss Universe pageant was held at Crocus City Hall, owned by Aras Agalarov's Crocus Group. The company later discussed a potential Trump Tower Moscow project with Trump following the pageant.
Trump entered into a branding and licensing agreement with DAMAC Properties in 2013 to develop Trump International Golf Club Dubai and luxury villas in the United Arab Emirates.

Trump repeatedly expressed admiration for Vladimir Putin on social media and in interviews during 2013. Though Putin did not attend the Miss Universe pageant as Trump had publicly hoped, he reportedly sent Trump a gift and note. There is no confirmed direct meeting between them during this period.
Alimzhan Tokhtakhounov, who ran the gambling and money laundering operation out of Trump Tower in 2013, allegedly had ties to Semion Mogilevich's Russian organized crime network.

Aras Agalarov was a well-connected oligarch with close ties to Vladimir Putin. In 2013, Putin awarded Agalarov the Order of Honor, one of Russia's highest civilian decorations, indicating his status within the Kremlin's circle.

transactions.description: Aras Agalarov paid approximately $20 million for the rights to host the 2013 Miss Universe pageant in Moscow at his Crocus City Hall venue. The payment was reportedly routed through a Swiss bank account and a Delaware shell company.
